medical_history.chief_complaint: Shortness of breath, pleural effusions, and edema of the legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Shortness of breath developed five months before admission, increasing in severity; edema of the legs developed two weeks before admission. Symptoms were aggravated by exertion, and previous episodes improved temporarily with furosemide. Prior to this, a history of progressive systemic illness affecting multiple organs was noted over the year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation diagnosed seven years ago, treated with pacemaker. Angina diagnosed two and a half years prior, managed with three-vessel coronary-artery bypass grafting. Ischemic colitis leading to subtotal colectomy nine months prior. Episodes of congestive heart failure and proteinuria (3+ eleven months before admission).
medical_history.family_history: Both parents and several uncles had coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is retired, lives with his wife, does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
